Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:27 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Semley Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 14:37 - Thanks for bearing with us today; I know having a power cut can be difficult, but we've had some good news from our staff.

Our engineers have made good headway with their repairs, and based on how things are progressing they now hope to have power back on by 17:00 and 18:00; a little ahead of their estimate.

We want to get your power back on as quickly as we can, but I know any change to our estimated time frame may have disrupted your plans. Our staff always have safety in mind, so sometimes our time frames have to change at short notice, so I'll keep you updated and if our staff offer any adjustment to this new time frame, I'll let you know.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Will, Decasta and David are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:39 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers been able ot carry out partial repairs on the underground network in the Hazelbury Crescent area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Hazelbury Crescent area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Simon at 12:33.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us the excavations and repairs are taking longer than they first expected.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 12:00 and 13:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Simon at 11:11.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:30 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that further excavations are required to be able to complete the repairs safely. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 16:30-17:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:14 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers investigated the cause of the power cut in the Belvedere Close area. We can now confirm that the issue is a fault on our underground electricity cabling and there are 3 properties affected, which we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us over today.

Our specialist cable jointers have so far been unable to pinpoint the underground cabling fault, so they have instructed our digging gang to excavate our cabling. This will allow them to cut our cable, and using specialist equipment, test each side to help narrow down where the fault lies.

Our digging team are now starting excavations, but due to the surface material and how much space will be needed for our engineers to assess the fault safely, we're now estimating power will be back on by 14:30-15:30.

We're sorry to change our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated and our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Simon at 09:09
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:21 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the overhead cable that has come down on the ground, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 69 properties in the Aylesbury HP17 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving an overhead cable that has come down on the ground, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 11:05 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Aylesbury HP17 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 13:30 and 14:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the BR6 0 area to investigate the power cut affecting approximately 568 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Bev at 12:42.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 11:54 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an underground cable fault.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 14:30 and 15:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Zainab from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 15:30. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 17:53 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 22 customers in the Hoe Lane area to safely repair make repairs to our overhead network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Kevin at 17:05 -

We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was caused by an unexpected fault on our network; with safety in mind, we had to turn off power to 985 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to say our staff have now diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. We aim to provide a 10/10 service in keeping you updated, so if you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 14:17 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 802 customers in the Bedford MK44, Sandy SG19 area, by diverting power around a fault on our network . This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 14:03 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is on our overhead network that initially interrupted power to 802 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 472 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 15:00 and 16:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

To fix the issue permanently we're trying to find the underlying root cause, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Spring Gardens area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 19:00-20:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Stuart at 14:38.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 14:07 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Spring Gardens area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 19:00 and 20:00, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 18:15 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Sent by Kevin at 18:20 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1634 customers in the Waltham Abbey EN9 and surrounding  area, by diverting power around an overhead network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Waltham Abbey EN9 and surrounding  area to investigate the power cut affecting 7 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Kevin at 17:58.

Sent by Aaron at 23:40 - Thanks for bearing with us over tonight. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team will now begin excavations, and this can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 19:15 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hovefields Avenue area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hovefields Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Kevin at 19:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 18:55 - Our staff are on the way to the Hovefields Avenue area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 22:00 and 23:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Sent by Kevin at 19:19 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, but we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 20:38. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 22:35 - We can now confirm that all power in the High Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Aaron at 22:14.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Just to let you know our staff have now arrived back on site in the High Street area. They are going to test our equipment thoroughly to check if the underlying issue can be located before they attempt to restore your power again.

I know having power cuts this often must be causing you a lot of problems, and our staff are doing everything they can to keep the power on. Our time frame remains unchanged, and we're keeping in contact with our staff regularly to make sure you have the best information to plan ahead.

I'll update you as soon as we hear more from them. Sent by Stuart at 21:54.
